metadata.title: CVE-2021-38205 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
drivers/net/ethernet/xilinx/xilinx_emaclite.c in the Linux kernel before5.13.3 makes it easier for attackers to defeat an ASLR protection mechanismbecause it prints a kernel pointer (i.e., the real IOMEM pointer).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1124-azure - 4.15.0-1124.137~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1124.137~14.04.1').
